Package fluent.ly

Class ___.Variant

  • java.lang.Object
    • fluent.ly.___.Variant
  • Enclosing class:
    ___
    public static final class ___.Variant
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to emulate Eiffel's variant construct. To use, create an object of this type, initializing it with the variant's first value , and then call function check(int) successively.
    Since:
    05/06/2007
    Author:
    Yossi Gil

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Variant​(int value)
      Initialize a variant, with a specified value

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void check​(int newValue)
      reset the variant value to a new, smaller value value; abort if the new value is negative or no lesser than the previous value.
      int value()
      inspect the variant's value.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Variant

        public Variant​(int value)
        throws ___.Bug.Assertion.Variant.Initial
        Initialize a variant, with a specified value
        Parameters:
        value - a non-negative value
        Throws:
        ___.Bug.Assertion.Variant.Initial - in case initial value is negative

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public void check​(int newValue)
           throws ___.Bug.Assertion.Variant.Nondecreasing,
                  ___.Bug.Assertion.Variant.Underflow
        reset the variant value to a new, smaller value value; abort if the new value is negative or no lesser than the previous value.
        Parameters:
        newValue - the next value of this variant.
        Throws:
        ___.Bug.Assertion.Variant.Nondecreasing - in case the variant's value did not decrease
        ___.Bug.Assertion.Variant.Underflow - in case the variant's value went negative

      • value

        public int value()
        inspect the variant's value.
        Returns:
        a non-negative integer which is the current value of this object
